economic_opportunity_profile.short_description: A measure of the economic opportunities available within a community.
economic_opportunity_profile.long_description: A measure of the economic opportunities available within a community. Includes the employment accessibility indicator, the income inequality indicator, and the job participation indicator.
economic_opportunity_profile.statement: The economic opportunity profile in {features.name} is {value}.

education_index.short_description: The average number of years of schooling among adults in the community.
education_index.long_description: The average number of years of schooling among adults in the community. It can range from zero (those with no formal schooling) to 20 (those with a doctorate/professional degree).

employment_accessibility_index.short_description: A measure of the number of jobs accessible to members of the community.
employment_accessibility_index.long_description: A measure of the number of jobs accessible to members of the community. Accessibility is determined by distance: close jobs are more accessible than jobs farther away.
employment_accessibility_index.statement: The employment accessibility index in {features.name} is {value}.

food_accessibility_index.short_description: A measure of access to food by low income people within a community.
food_accessibility_index.long_description: A measure of access to food by low income people within a community. It measures the proportion of the low income community that has a large grocery store within 1 mile in urban areas or 10 miles in rural areas.
food_accessibility_index.statement: The food accessibility indicator in {features.name} is {value}.

health_opportunity_profile.short_description: A group of indicators that provide broad insight into the overall opportunity Virginians have to live long and healthy lives.
health_opportunity_profile.long_description: A group of indicators that provide broad insight into the overall opportunity Virginians have to live long and healthy lives based on the Social Determinants of Health. It is a hierarchical index that allows users to examine social determinants of health at multiple levels of detail in Virginia. It is made up of over 30 variables, combined into 13 indicators, grouped into four profiles, which are aggregated into a single Health Opportunity Index. The HOI is reported at both the census tract and county/independent city level.
health_opportunity_profile.statement: The health opportunity index in {features.name} is {value}.

income_inequality_index.short_description: The Gini Index, a common measure of income inequality.
income_inequality_index.long_description: The Gini Index, a common measure of income inequality, measures whether the income earned within a community is distributed broadly or concentrated within the hands of small number of households.
income_inequality_index.statement: The income inequality index in {features.name} is {value}.

job_participation_index.short_description: The percentage of individuals 16-64 years of age active in the civilian labor force.
job_participation_index.long_description: The percentage of individuals 16-64 years of age active in the civilian labor force. It includes both those currently working and those seeking work.
job_participation_index.statement: The job participation index in {features.name} is {value}.

material_deprevation_index.short_description: Based on the Towsend Material Deprivation Index, it examines the private material resources available to households in a community.
material_deprevation_index.long_description: Based on the Towsend Material Deprivation Index, it examines the private material resources available to households in a community. 4 indicators make up Towsend: overcrowding (>2 persons per room), unemployment, % of persons no vehicle or car, and % of person who rent.
material_deprevation_index.statement: The material deprivation indicator in {features.name} is {value}.

pop_churning_index.short_description: The amount of population turnover within a community.
pop_churning_index.long_description: The amount of population turnover within a community. It measure the rate at which people both move into a community and move out of a community.
pop_churning_index.statement: The population churning index in {features.name} is {value}.

pop_density_index.short_description: A measure of population density that takes into account the density levels most people in the community experience.
pop_density_index.long_description: A measure of population density that takes into account the density levels most people in the community experience.
pop_density_index.statement: The population density indicator in {features.name} is {value}.

segregation_index.short_description: A measure of whether and how much people of different racial and ethnic backgrounds live together in diverse communities.
segregation_index.long_description: A measure of whether and how much people of different racial and ethnic backgrounds live together in diverse communities. It includes measures of both community diversity and the distance between communities with different racial or ethnic profiles.

walkability_index.short_description: A measure of how walkable a community is.
walkability_index.long_description: A measure of how walkable a community is based on residential and employment density, land use (destination) diversity, street connectivity and public transit accessibility.

wellness_disparity_profile.short_description: A measure of the disparate access to health services within a community.
wellness_disparity_profile.long_description: A measure of the disparate access to health services within a community. It includes the access to care indicator and the segregation indicator.
wellness_disparity_profile.statement: The wellness disparity profile in {features.name} is {value}.

consumer_opportunity_profile.short_description: A measure of the consumer resources available within a community.
consumer_opportunity_profile.long_description: A measure of the consumer resources available within a community. It includes the affordability indicator, the education indicator, the food accessbility indicator, and the material deprevation indicator.
consumer_opportunity_profile.statement: The consumer opportunity profile in {features.name} is {value}.

affordability_index.short_description: The proportion of a community’s income spent on housing and transportation.
affordability_index.long_description: The proportion of a community’s income spent on housing and transportation. This indicates how much income remains for other priorities, including food, health care and social activities.

air_quality_index.short_description: Includes EPA measures of pollution, including on-road, non-road and non-point pollution, and EPA measures of neurological, cancer and respiration risk..
air_quality_index.long_description: Includes EPA measures of pollution, including on-road, non-road and non-point pollution, and EPA measures of neurological, cancer and respiration risk.
air_quality_index.statement: The air quality indicator in {features.name} is {value}.

community_environmental_profile.short_description: A measure of the natural, built and social environment of a community.
community_environmental_profile.long_description: A measure of the natural, built and social environment of a community. It includes the air quality indicator, the population churning indicator, the population density indicator, and the walkability indicator.
community_environmental_profile.statement: The community environmental profile in {features.name} is {value}.

access_to_care_index.short_description: Whether community members have access to a primary care physician and the means to pay for care..
access_to_care_index.long_description: Whether community members have access to a primary care physician and the means to pay for care. It includes the proportion of uninsured residents and the number of physicians within 30 miles of the community.
access_to_care_index.statement: The access to care indicator in {features.name} is {value}.
